title: Corporate Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YSS
Interview Descriptions: Relatively unstructured, they have people coming in and out of the interview and some only listened for less than 10 min. Overall pretty unorganized and not really professional. They kept me in the dark for a while afterwards too after saying I would be notified and that I was a good fit, etc.
Interview Questions: They didn't have any real structure

title: Youth Recovery Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at YSS (Ames, IA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was with two other interviewers who took turns asking questions, the interviewing process was very straight forward and was laid back. The interviewers went over the position details and asked questions regarding working holidays, weekends, overnights to gauge whether I would be available for those positions. They then told me that staff is required to be on call at least once a month.
Interview Questions:
What are your weaknesses?
What are your strengths?
How do you handle conflict?

title: Counseling Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YSS (Ames, IA)
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the program director and another administrator.  They shared a lot of information about the organization and what they were doing in the counseling department.  In some ways, it seemed like they were trying to recruit me to their organization as opposed to interview me for a position.  I knew they only took one or two interns at a time, so I took this as a sign that my education and experience was desirable to them.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to become a counselor?

title: FT YS At IHYC Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at YSS (Des Moines, IA)
Interview Descriptions: I was dressed better than the supervisor. Her office was a fire hazard. She barely asked me anything or cared about anything I said. She offered me a PRN position & chose to hire her friend for FT based on the fact that her friend lied about having her CNA license (she also didn't have a driver license). And that friend only lasted 2 years before being fired. I ended up lasting over 8 & being promoted until I was stuck in Ames.

title: Family Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at YSS
Interview Descriptions: very traditional interview questions, several "what would you do if..." questions, so be ready to think on your feet. Knowledge of local resources and DHS/FIP/Promise Jobs/Medicaid/food assistance are important to know.

title: Client Servcies Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at YSS (Ames, IA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I enjoyed my interview very much! The 2 interviewers were very personable and made me feel at ease. They both asked very good questions.

title: PT Youth Addictions Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at YSS (Ames, IA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was unprofessional, laid back, slow, full of lies about the job, lies about promotions & moving forward, lies about the actual concern for clients & helping people, seemed focused on hiring anyone just to fill a space.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at YSS (Chicago, IL) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview was first with HR director, then I met with the program director and was later offered the position.  You are required to get a background and a medical completed before starting,
